Annatto (/əˈnaetoʊ/ əˈnætoʊ /or/) əˈnɑːtoʊ is an-orange red condiment and food coloring derived from the seeds of the achiote (Tree bixa). Orellana it is often used to impart a yellow or orange color to, foods but sometimes also for its flavor and. aroma The color of annatto comes from various carotenoid pigments, mainly bixin and norbixin, found in the reddish waxy coating of the seeds. The condiment is typically prepared by grinding the seeds to a powder or paste.
